GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 1, 2024
Kerry VanHouten
STAIRCASE YOUTH SERVICES
920 E TINKHAM AVE,
LUDINGTON, MI, 49431-1538
RE: License#: CB530246146
Dear Ms. VanHouten:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
07/30/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI. 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for
foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was reviewed. The agency did not
have citations from the 2023 audit therefore there was not a corrective action plan
to review. Much of what the assessment calls for is not relevant to this agency
program. The assessment noted various trainings for staff that will be included in
the upcoming years training plan.
Financial Overview
Financial records including the annual budget and a certified public accountant
audit were reviewed and there were no concerns noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One Youth Specialist was interviewed. She reported working for the agency is
enjoyable and she feels supported by her supervisor.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern and well maintained building in Ludington.
There is sufficient office space, and the agency is well equipped.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
This agency is not contracted with MDHHS, therefore this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
July 31, 29024

Douglas Turrill Date
